comment.author: 84351393@N00
comment._content: Gosh. You geotagged this, and I went looking for the nearest geotagged commons image to me in Bristol. Do you know, I've lived in Bristol since 1994 and had never been to Burnham-on-Sea until two months ago. Then I spent an innordinate amount of time photographing a nine legged lighthouse on the foreshore. This makes me want to go back and take a comparative photograph from this vantage point, to see how much/what/if anything has changed since 1903. It wouldn't be too difficult for me to do I don't think... Do you have any non-geotagged images of that lighthouse? It's been there for a long time to merit archive images I think....

comment.author: 84351393@N00
comment._content: I'm back. The lighthouse (or the original version of it, and it is one of several on that bit of the coast) was built in 1832 apparently, it would be really interesting if there was any footage of it. It's still used as a navigation aid today...

comment.author: 30355834720@N01
comment._content: Hello Trapac - and thanks for sharing your photographs of the lighthouse. According to the museum's catalogue of historic photographs, this is what's available: - G3638 B 26 Jun. 1898 Paddle steamer WAVERLEY alongside the jetty, embarking passengers. - G3639 B 26 Jun. 1898 The jetty at low tide with small paddle steamer PETREL moored offshore. - G2405 B ca.1888 The seafront and beach. In the foreground donkey boys and their donkeys. - G2406 B ca.1888 The paddle steamer SHERBRO backs away from the jetty. - G3062 B ca.1904 The seafront and beach. Do you think the lighthouse would feature in any of these?

comment.realname: Thank you for your generous offers of peanuts.
comment.author: 40806787@N06
comment._content:
It hasn't changed much! - although the profile of the sea wall has changed (it was replaced in the 1980s) most of those seafront buildings are still there.  This pic was probably taken from the Pavilion Pier which is also still active.
Despite being a famous landmark, the lighthouse is unlikely to feature significantly in any of those pictures, as it's much further up the coast ('behind us' in this view), not really near the main holidaymakers beach.
PS Waverley is still operational and tours the channel in summer, but does not dock at Burnham.
